title: Lab Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: When I first arrived, I met with a lab manager and she spoke to me about the position and asked me questions about my previous experience. Then she showed me around the facility. They also had me meet with other members of the team.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background in school

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied on the the website and got a response within a few days. HR met with me and asked me some questions then I was informed about the salary and when benefits would kick in.
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths and weaknesses?

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: The first interview with the Manager first, then a Team interview for the second round. About six people in the Team interview. Made you feel welcomed and not pressured. Offer was then extended from HR
Interview Questions: Very situational, lots of questions like "describe a time where you "

title: ER Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Quick, 30 minute interview with the hiring managers in the ED. They were very friendly and asked about my past clinical experiences. We also discussed my motivations for going into the medical field.
Interview Questions: What previous clinical experiences do you have?

title: Certified Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: very simple a  phone interview followed by in person interview with two managers and one lead pharmacy technician. couple days after I got the job offer. After you have to provide at least three  professional references.  Drug test, etc..
Interview Questions: question about previous job experience.

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a interview, came into the HR Department for an initial interview with the HR team. Then had a meeting with the manager, overall great interview experience. Same basic interview questions.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Environmental Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: I arrived in the HR department 15mins early. A rep met me a couole minutes after I arrived. They went over basic life questions. What to expect during tye hiring process. I then was taken to meet with the manager who runs the dept as well as the supervisor who runs the shift I applies for. They went over my resume. Discussed the job and expectations. After about 20mins the interview was over.
Interview Questions: Why did I apply to work there?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: Position applied for was confusing and did not specify the hours or department applying to. HR was easy to communicate with and the interview process went smoothly, Was interviewed first by supervisor and then by a few workers doing the job
Interview Questions: Do you work well in a fast paced enviornment

title: Clinical Nurse Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Completed the online application and received a phone call three days later. I was scheduled to interview with the Nurse Recruiter, Nurse Manager, then a peer interview. I was given my hourly pay rate based off of years of experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: Patient Care Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Fill out application online, if contacted schedule an in person interview. The job you applied for will not be specified if you applied for multiple. Multiple managers from different units/floors may interview you during out sitting. The staff was friendly and conversation was relaxed. Usual interview questions were asked. If you are contacted again you are asked to provide resources/contacts. There professionals will need to fill out an online survey about working with you in previous jobs/ academic settings. You will be offered the job and given an orientation date if you accept the offer.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Where do you see yourself in the future?

title: Admin Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: Briefly met with HR recruiter. She did not disclosure salary, ETO accural rates, etc. Then met with Director, very nice. Not many questions about me or resume, more discusssion about the position.
Interview Questions: What is a typical day at your current employer?

title: Tech Aide Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Initial meeting with Human Resources, than with Manager and if all goes well you will meet the team you will be working with. Basic Interviewing questions were asked what interested you in position, where do you see yourself in 5 years.
Interview Questions: What interested you about this job?

title: Medical Laboratory Scientist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Peer review and one on one interview with a tour. Everyone was very kind and welcoming. Everyone who interviewed me was going to be my direct colleague/ on my shift.
Interview Questions: When was the last time you had a disagreement with a colleague and how did you handle it?

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Applied on the careers/job tab Lowell General's website. The interview process was friendly.	
Two phone interviews -- one with HR and one with the hiring manager. The hiring manager didn't ask me any silly interview questions - it was just a conversation about my skills. About a week and a half later, I was invited for an in-person interview with two team members. The in-person was a breeze. It didn't seem like an interview. I just had a conversation with two team members on-site, about what I'd be working on when I initially start the role.
Interview Questions: How do you work through language barriers?

title: Behavioral Health Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: Hr was a bit scattered. Told different things by different hr people. Met with many people. Job description seemed to warrant someone with more than a h.s. Degree requirement. Salary  was very low and non negotiable.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you want to work here

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, HR called me about 3 days later. I met with the hiring manager and director. Then they asked me to come back a week later to meet the team. I never seen my work station and was surprised it was very tight when I started. The orientation was a full day and excellent
Interview Questions: Describe how you handled a difficult situation

title: Clinical Role Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Waste of time. None of the people who said were going to interview was present. Completely unprofessional. Definitely had a candidate hired but was not professional enough to reach out and notify that the position was prior to the interview. Interviewer was just going through the motions. Another interviewer was out and said they would reach out but did not.
Interview Questions: Q: Why this position

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (Lowell, MA) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: Called  by recruiter about two weeks after application filled out and scheduled an interview for the following week. Met with recruiter for 20 minutes. Very casual. Basic questions about past experiences and what type of goals I had in mind. Then met with floor manager who arrived at the recruiters office to bring me to the floor. We discussed experience, goals, floor culture and work flow. Casual and friendly meeting lasting about 15 minutes. Received a call back later that day to say that the manager thought I was a good fit. Got a job offer 4 days later.
Interview Questions:
What's your work experience?
Are you at your other job?
Why are you seeking a job at LGH?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: You first meet with the nursing recruiter in HR. More of a casual/ laid back interview with basic questions about career goals, past experience and what your looking for in your position. Once this component is done you meet with the floor manager who also asks pretty fundamental questions. The  you meet with peers and do a peer interview which is more you asking questions than them.
Interview Questions: What is your five year plan for your career?

title: Informatics Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was routine.  Met with director and then manager.  Team interview followed during which point I had the opportunity to meet with each team member of not only the informatics team, but the nursing education team as well.  Questions were specific from each specialist but all were similar in nature tot he position focusing on project implementation, development, and training.
Interview Questions: Questions re: types of challenging projects in the past and experiencing integrating technology into health care environment

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed by unit manager and staff nurses. Interview was brief, approximately 30 minutes. Was asked questions about previous jobs/experience. Was informed about the workflow of the unit and what the expectations were.
Interview Questions: asked about previous work experience, skills, & goals.

title: Help Desk Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital
Interview Descriptions: Not very grueling - had 4 separate interviews across the whole team.  Mush more informational as opposed to direct questions about my experience. Team was very nice and more than happy to talk about their jobs.
Interview Questions: I can't think of any that I was asked that was either difficult of unexpected.

title: Security Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
I met with the hiring manager during my initial interview.  He clearly informed me about the position that I was applying for in detail.  The manager pointed out that there may be times when we have to go  hands on with patients who may become physically violent.  Although, he made one thing clear - our initial intervention with anyone who is escalated starts with verbal intervention.  The initial interview went really well in my opinion.  

The second step in the interviewing process was the peer interview.  I met with a panel of five security officers during the second round.  Each one of them ask me situational questions pertaining to the position and what I would do in when confronted with them.  Needless to say, I made it through the second round unscathed.  I felt very comfortable speaking to these individual.  I knew right then that I would definitely want to be a part of this special team.
Interview Questions: The one question that caught me off guard was asked during the second phase of the interview.  What would you do if you see one of your colleague lose control of his / her temper during a physical intervention with a patient and did something unethical?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital (New York, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Timely scheduling, met with the head of the cardio/rehab services dept and a staff PT approx halfway through the interview process. Comfortable conversation, appropriate line of questions, good flow. Was able to ask questions freely.
Interview Questions: What is your comfort level in the acute environment?

title: Quality Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lowell General Hospital in Aug 2009
Interview Descriptions: HR specialist contacted and scheduled an interview. I spoke with her for about 25 mins and then spoke to the Manager.After initial few minutes I realised I was not fit for the job, I was surprised that the research they did on me was pooorr....and so I was not selected.
Interview Questions: general question on resume
